title: Delhi Assembly poll schedule LIVE updates: Election Commission to announce dates shortly - The Hindu
summary:
Delhi Assembly Elections 2025 LIVE: Voting on February 5, counting on February 8

Date & Source: January 07, 2025 - The Hindu

The announcement for the Delhi Assembly elections has been made, with voting scheduled for February 5, 2025, and counting of votes set for February 8, 2025.

  • Single-phase elections will be conducted in Delhi.
  • The Delhi Chief Election Commissioner emphasized a crackdown on the use of money power during elections.
  • Easy access and provisions for senior citizens and persons with disabilities will be ensured.
“India has a gold standard of elections, it’s a shared legacy for all of us including all political parties,” - CEC Rajiv Kumar.

This election is poised to influence the political landscape of Delhi significantly, highlighting key issues such as electoral integrity and participation rights.
newTitle: Delhi Assembly Election Scheduled for February 5, Vote Counting on February 8

title: Where Is Atul Subhash's Son? Nikita Singhania's Lawyer Replies In Top Court - NDTV
summary:
Court's 'Stranger' Remark As Atul Subhash's Mother Seeks Grandson's Custody

Publication Date: Recent, Source: Not specified

In a custody battle concerning AI techie Atul Subhash's four-year-old son, his estranged wife, Nikita Singhania, revealed to the Supreme Court that the child is currently in a boarding school in Faridabad, Haryana. Following Atul's tragic suicide in December, his mother Anju Devi is seeking custody.

  • Atul Subhash took his own life after accusing Nikita of harassment.
  • Nikita's family is facing abetment to suicide charges.
  • The Supreme Court directed that the child be produced in the next hearing.
  • Concerns raised about the child's unfamiliarity with his grandmother.
  • The custody issue is to be decided in the appropriate court.
“Sorry to say but the child is a stranger to the petitioner,” remarked Justice Nagaratna.

The next hearing is scheduled for January 20.
newTitle: Court's 'Stranger' Remark in Custody Battle of Atul Subhash's Son

title: Delhi Election Live Updates: Arvind Kejriwal launches campaign song for assembly polls - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi Election Live Updates: Election Commission to announce Delhi polls schedule shortly

Publication Date: Recent updates from the Election Commission.

The Election Commission of India is set to announce the schedule for the General Election for the Legislative Assembly of Delhi. This announcement comes amidst a political row regarding the voter roll.

  • The Election Commission's press briefing is scheduled for 2:00 PM.
  • The term of the 70-member Assembly ends on February 23.
  • The final electoral roll shows over 1.55 crore registered voters in Delhi.
  • First-time voters aged 18-19 have increased by 52,554 since the last electoral roll.
  • AAP’s campaign song was released, highlighting achievements in governance.
  • Allegations of voter list manipulations raised by both AAP and BJP.
"We celebrate our elections like festivals, and people wait for our song; now it's out, and people can dance to it." - Arvind Kejriwal

The upcoming elections in Delhi are generating significant interest, with preparations underway from all political parties.
newTitle: Delhi Election Live Updates: Election Commission to announce Delhi polls schedule shortly

title: Supreme Court Grants Interim Bail To Asaram Bapu In Rape Case For Medical Treatment - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Grants Interim Bail To Asaram Bapu In Rape Case For Medical Treatment

Publication Date: January 7
Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court has granted interim bail to self-styled godman Asaram Bapu, who is serving a life sentence in a rape case, allowing him to seek medical treatment until March 31, 2025.

  • The bail was granted by Justices M.M. Sundresh and Rajesh Bindal, with a condition that Asaram must not meet his followers while released.
  • Asaram's legal team argued his health condition justified the need for bail, citing his advanced age and history of heart problems.
  • The Solicitor General opposed the bail, stating Asaram has adequate medical care in jail.
  • The bail was issued on humanitarian grounds, with the court allowing for a reassessment of Asaram's medical status closer to the end of the bail period.
  • The original conviction involved multiple charges of rape and other serious offenses against a female disciple.
“The relief was granted solely on humanitarian grounds.”

This decision allows Asaram to undergo necessary medical treatment while under specific conditions imposed by the court.
newTitle: Supreme Court Grants Interim Bail To Asaram Bapu In Rape Case For Medical Treatment

title: Rape Convict Asaram Bapu Gets Interim Bail, But Can't Meet His Followers - NDTV
summary:
Asaram Granted Interim Bail by Supreme Court Despite Rape Convictions

Date: Recent news from Source: NDTV

A week after self-styled godman Asaram returned to jail from a previous parole, the Supreme Court has granted him interim bail on medical grounds in a 2013 rape case. However, he will remain incarcerated as he seeks bail in another case.

  • Asaram, 83, was convicted for raping a teenager in his Jodhpur ashram in 2013.
  • He has been sentenced to life imprisonment for the crime.
  • The court granted bail until March 31, with restrictions on meeting followers.
  • Police are instructed to escort him only for medical treatment.
  • Asaram's lawyers cited serious medical ailments in their request for bail.
Asaram is suffering from serious medical ailments.

The court's decision reflects ongoing legal proceedings amid his multiple convictions.
newTitle: Asaram Granted Interim Bail by Supreme Court Despite Rape Convictions

title: Madhya Pradesh: Doctor arrested for raping colleague inside abandoned govt medical college hostel - Hindustan Times
HMPV cases live: Centre, health experts appeal for calm after five test positive - Hindustan Times
summary:
HMPV cases live: Odisha begins testing at several places following Centre advisory

Date: January 6, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The article discusses the initiation of testing for Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) in Odisha following guidance from the Centre after isolated cases were reported. It emphasizes the health measures being undertaken across various states.

  • Five cases of HMPV reported across India.
  • Odisha has started testing at several locations.
  • Symptoms include mild cold-like signs, with serious risks for young children and immunocompromised individuals.
  • No significant outbreak reported, and health officials urge calm.
“There is no need to panic,” said Gujarat Health Minister Rushikesh Patel.

In conclusion, while HMPV cases are being monitored, officials stress preparedness and public awareness over alarm.
newTitle: Odisha Initiates Testing for HMPV Cases Following Centre Advisory

title: Telangana High Court refuses to quash FIR against BRS MLA KT Rama Rao in Formula E Race case - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Telangana High Court Upholds FIR Against BRS MLA KT Rama Rao in Formula E Race Funding Case

Published on: 07 Jan 2025, 6:22 am

The Telangana High Court has refused to quash an FIR against BRS MLA K.T. Rama Rao related to allegations of corruption in the Formula E race funding case. The ruling comes amid claims of political vendetta and serious charges against Rao.

  • Justice K Lakshman dismissed the plea to quash the FIR.
  • The FIR involves charges of criminal breach of trust and violations of the Prevention of Corruption Act.
  • The allegations stem from irregularities in funding for the Formula E race, which was cancelled after the Congress took power.
  • Rao's counsel argued the case is politically motivated.
  • The State's Advocate General noted serious allegations against Rao, including alleged misappropriation of funds.
“Rao cannot be prosecuted simply on account of a policy decision taken in 2023.” - KTR's Senior Advocate C Aryama Sundaram

The court's decision reinforces serious scrutiny over the financial dealings associated with significant events in Telangana.
newTitle: Telangana High Court Upholds FIR Against BRS MLA KT Rama Rao in Formula E Race Funding Case

title: Assam mine: Three feared dead as India deploys divers, helicopters to rescue trapped miners - CNN
summary:
Three Feared Dead as India Deploys Divers, Helicopters to Rescue Trapped Miners

Date: January 7, 2025 Source: CNN

Three miners are feared dead inside a flooded coal mine in Assam, India, as rescue teams work overnight to reach nine men trapped inside the mine.

  • Rescue teams reported spotting three bodies but have not yet recovered them.
  • The army has deployed divers, helicopters, and engineers for rescue operations.
  • The incident occurred due to flooding in the mine, likely caused by hitting a water channel.
  • Coal mining disasters are common in northeastern India, with past incidents resulting in significant casualties.
“The mine got flooded yesterday — the source was internal. They probably hit some water channel and water came out and flooded it,” Mayank Kumar, district police chief in Dima Hasao.

The rescue operation is ongoing, with efforts focused on reaching the nine trapped miners and recovering the bodies.
newTitle: Three Feared Dead as India Deploys Divers, Helicopters to Rescue Trapped Miners

title: GATE 2025 Admit Card Released on gate2025.iitr.ac.in, Direct Link - Times Now
summary:
GATE 2025 Admit Card Released on gate2025.iitr.ac.in, Direct Link

Publication Date: Today. Source: Times Now

The Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering (GATE) admit card has been released today, serving as a crucial document for candidates.

  • Essential for admission to postgraduate programs in IITs and IISc.
  • Must carry the admit card and a valid photo ID to the exam center.
  • GATE scores are also used by PSUs for recruitment.
  • Conducted jointly by IITs and IISc.

GATE 2025 Hall Ticket: Here's how to download admit card

  1. Visit the official website - gate2025.iitr.ac.in
  2. Access the GOAPS portal and log in.
  3. Enter enrollment ID and password.
  4. Download the admit card.

The GATE exam will occur on February 1, 2, 15, and 16, 2025.
newTitle: GATE 2025 Admit Card Released on gate2025.iitr.ac.in, Direct Link

title: HMPV cases live: Centre advises states to strengthen awareness measures - Hindustan Times
summary:
HMPV cases live: Centre advises states to strengthen awareness measures

Publication Date: January 6, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Health authorities are advising states to increase public awareness and preparedness as five cases of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) infections have been reported in India. The Centre emphasizes that these infections are manageable and not a cause for panic.

  • Five cases of HMPV reported in India, with no widespread outbreak.
  • Children under 3 and immunocompromised individuals advised to take precautions.
  • Health systems are being prepared to manage potential surges in cases.
  • Public health guidelines are being issued to strengthen awareness.
  • Health experts state that HMPV has been circulating globally since its identification in 2001.
“There is no need to panic. The government is ready for any situation.” - Uttar Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Brajesh Pathak

In conclusion, while cases of HMPV have been identified, health experts reassure the public that it is not a new virus, and normal precautions should suffice to prevent serious illness.
newTitle: Increase in HMPV Cases: Health Measures and Public Awareness Urged

Three feared dead as India deploys divers, helicopters to rescue trapped miners - CNN
summary:
Three feared dead as India deploys divers, helicopters to rescue trapped miners

Publication Date: Not specified   |   Source: CNN

Three miners are feared dead inside a flooded coal mine in Assam, India, while rescue teams are desperately trying to reach the trapped individuals.

  • Three bodies have been spotted but not yet recovered.
  • A total of nine men have been trapped since Monday in the mine.
  • Rescue operations involve army teams deploying divers and helicopters.
  • The mine flooded due to an internal water channel that was likely hit by the miners.
  • Previous coal mine disasters in northeastern India highlight ongoing safety concerns.
“The mine got flooded yesterday — the source was internal. They (the miners) probably hit some water channel and water came out and flooded it,” - Mayank Kumar, district police chief in Dima Hasao.

Efforts continue as local authorities and rescue teams strive to recover those trapped and prevent further loss of life.
newTitle: Three Feared Dead as Rescue Operations Continue for Trapped Miners in India

title: Delhi Assembly poll schedule LIVE updates: Election Commission to announce dates at 2 p.m. - The Hindu
summary:
Delhi Assembly poll schedule LIVE updates: Election Commission to announce dates at 2 p.m.

Date Published: January 07, 2025

Source: The Hindu

The Election Commission of India is set to announce the schedule for the Delhi Assembly elections today at 2 p.m. Follow live updates on developments.

  • The upcoming elections will have a three-cornered contest between BJP, Congress, and AAP.
  • AAP leader Arvind Kejriwal has announced ₹10 lakh insurance for auto drivers.
  • The turnout for new voter registrations is unprecedented, with an increase of over 1.67 lakh names on the electoral roll.
“I wrote to the Chief Election Commissioner, with all these details, on how the large scale voter scam is happening in the New Delhi Assembly constituency.” – Atishi, Delhi Chief Minister.

This election is crucial, as it will shape political dynamics in Delhi.

title: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar visits Konark Sun Temple in Odisha ahead of Pravasi Bharatiya Divas - OTV News
summary:
S Jaishankar Visits Konark Sun Temple Ahead of Pravasi Bharatiya Divas

Publication Date: Recent

Source: OTV News

Ahead of the Pravasi Bharatiya Divas in Odisha, Indian External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar visited the Konark Sun Temple and Interpretation Centre.

  • Jaishankar commenced his visit at the Interpretation Centre, which showcases the cultural significance of Konark.
  • Non-Resident Indians (NRIs) gathered in Bhubaneswar for the Pravasi Bharatiya Divas celebrations.
  • Attendees visited the sacred Jagannath Temple in Puri, seeking blessings.
  • The event emphasizes the connection between India and its overseas citizens while showcasing Odisha’s cultural heritage.
Several visitors expressed their joy and appreciation for the spiritual experience at the Konark Sun Temple.

This visit fosters a deeper connection for NRIs with their heritage, enriching their cultural experience in Odisha.
newTitle: S Jaishankar Visits Konark Sun Temple Ahead of Pravasi Bharatiya Divas

title: Money Cannot Substitute Life Lost But Effort Has To Be Made For Granting Just Compensation: SC Enhances... - Verdictum
summary:
Money Cannot Substitute Life Lost But Effort Has To Be Made For Granting Just Compensation: SC Enhances...

Publication Date: N/A Source: N/A

The Supreme Court enhanced the compensation awarded to a victim of a motor accident, emphasizing the need for just compensation despite the fact that money cannot replace a lost life.

  • The Supreme Court allowed an appeal, increasing the compensation from the Motor Accident Claims Tribunal (MACT) to Rs. 48,00,000.
  • The High Court was found to have “utterly failed” to properly assess other compensation aspects aside from loss of income.
  • The Appellant, a B.Tech student, suffered 60% permanent disability due to a truck accident caused by negligent driving.
  • The Supreme Court noted the MACT’s inadequate compensation for non-pecuniary losses.
  • The court stated that an effort must be made to provide just compensation as financial restitution.
“It is well accepted norm that money cannot substitute a life lost but an effort has to be made for grant of just compensation so far as money can compensate.”

In conclusion, the Supreme Court's ruling bolsters the importance of comprehensive compensation assessments in personal injury cases.
newTitle: Supreme Court Enhances Compensation for Accident Victim

title: Congress-AIMIM alliance: Revanth Reddy coins ‘Ayya-Miyan unity’ slogan - The Siasat Daily
summary:
Congress-AIMIM alliance: Revanth Reddy coins 'Ayya-Miyan unity' slogan

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Siasat Daily

Hyderabad: Telangana Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy has officially announced an alliance between Congress and AIMIM to focus on Hyderabad’s development.

  • “When Ayya and Miyan unite, nothing can stop progress,” said the Chief Minister during the Aramghar flyover inauguration.
  • He aims to replace the popular “Jai Meem Jai Bheem” slogan with a Telangana version.
  • Key projects include a second cable bridge over Mir Alam Tank, new Osmania General Hospital building, and naming the Aramghar flyover after Manmohan Singh.
  • A Congress-AIMIM meeting will take place to discuss future projects and funding.
“I am ready to fight Narendra Modi and meet Asaduddin Owaisi for the progress of the state.” - Revanth Reddy

This alliance aims for significant developmental strides in Hyderabad, uniting two major political parties for progress.
newTitle: Congress and AIMIM Form Alliance for Hyderabad's Development

Mumbai fraud: Investors gather outside Torres Jewellery office in Dadar over unpaid returns; company blames CEO | Today News - Mint
summary:
Investors Protest at Torres Jewellery Over Unpaid Returns in Mumbai

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Lokmat Times

A large crowd of investors gathered outside the Torres Jewellery office in Dadar, demanding refunds for the promised returns from the company’s investment schemes.

  • Investors had invested significant amounts, expecting weekly returns of 10%.
  • The company failed to disburse instalments for the last two weeks.
  • Many investors stated, “We don't need interest, just the money back.”
  • The company's CEO, Tausif Reyaz, has been blamed for the fraudulent scheme.
  • Complaints have been registered against top executives for allegedly cheating investors.
“On investing ₹1 lakh in a scheme floated by the store, customers would get a discount of ₹10,000 on a pendant with a moissanite stone.”

The police have deployed security at the location as protests continue and the situation unfolds.
newTitle: Investors Protest at Torres Jewellery Over Unpaid Returns in Mumbai

title: Kite String Slits Man's Throat. He Was Returning After Buying Chinese Manjha - NDTV
Kite String Slits Man's Throat. He Was Returning After Buying Chinese Manjha - NDTV
32 dead as 7.1 magnitude earthquake strikes Nepal-Tibet border - Greater Kashmir
summary:
32 dead as 7.1 magnitude earthquake strikes Nepal-Tibet border

Date: January 7, 2024 | Source: New Delhi

At least 32 people lost their lives and 38 were injured after a 7.1-magnitude earthquake struck the Nepal-Tibet border.

  • The earthquake occurred at 6:35 AM (IST) with its epicenter located in Xizang (Tibet Autonomous Region).
  • Reported casualties include 32 deaths and 38 injuries in the region.
  • Significant structural damage was reported in Tonglai Village, leading to house collapses.
  • Subsequent tremors of 4.7 and 4.9 magnitude were recorded shortly after the initial quake.
  • The tremors were felt across parts of North India, causing panic among the residents.
“The seismic activity has heightened concerns in the region which is no stranger to devastating earthquakes.”

This tragic event highlights the ongoing seismic risks in the Himalayas and raises alarms about potential future quakes.
newTitle: 32 dead as 7.1 magnitude earthquake strikes Nepal-Tibet border

title: Delhi election: Poll official requests enhanced security, cites political pressure - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi election: Poll official requests enhanced security, cites political pressure

Date: Jan 07, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The New Delhi district election officer (DEO) has requested enhanced security due to alleged political interference ahead of the Delhi assembly elections.

  • The DEO claims to have faced political pressure regarding the voter list and sought police security for the DEO's office.
  • Accusations between the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) and the BJP regarding electoral roll irregularities have escalated.
  • Additional officials have echoed similar concerns about potential disruptions during election preparations.
“There is a possibility of breach of peace and pressures being imposed on the office functionaries,” said Additional District Magistrate Nishant Bodh.

The situation highlights growing tensions as the election approaches, necessitating urgent attention to ensure a fair electoral process.
newTitle: Delhi Election Official Raises Concerns Over Political Pressure and Security Needs

title: HMPV cases live: One person discharged, four others under medical observation - Hindustan Times
Investors protest over life savings in schemes after Navi Mumbai and Mumbai offices of firm found locked | Today News - Mint
summary:
Investors Protest Over Locked Offices of Investment Firm in Mumbai

Date: October 2023, Source: Live Mint

Hundreds of investors protested in Navi Mumbai after discovering that the offices of an investment firm were locked, amid allegations of a scam involving their life savings.

  • Protesters found offices in Dadar, Mumbai, and Bhayandar locked.
  • Many had invested their life savings in schemes promising high returns.
  • Police intervened to disperse the crowd of angry investors.
“Many investors claimed they had invested their life savings in the company's schemes which promised them substantial returns over a decade.”

The situation reflects growing concerns over investment scams in the region, highlighting the need for regulatory oversight and investor awareness.
newTitle: Investors Protest Over Locked Offices of Investment Firm in Mumbai

title: UGC draft norms remove NET as mandatory for assistant professor post - Hindustan Times
summary:
UGC Draft Norms Remove NET as Mandatory for Assistant Professor Post

Date: Jan 07, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The University Grants Commission (UGC) has announced new draft guidelines stating that clearing the National Eligibility Test (NET) is no longer mandatory for the appointment of assistant professors. These changes aim to promote diverse faculty backgrounds in alignment with the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020.

  • NET is no longer a compulsory qualification for assistant professor roles.
  • The draft norms allow hiring from multidisciplinary backgrounds, echoing the goals of NEP 2020.
  • The new regulations replace the 2018 norms and aim to provide more flexibility in faculty recruitment.
  • PhD is mandatory for promotions to associate professor and professor.
  • Special recruitment pathways are being introduced for fields like yoga, music, and sports.
“These draft regulations will infuse innovation, inclusivity, flexibility, and dynamism in every aspect of higher education...” - Dharmendra Pradhan

The changes reflect an effort to modernize higher education recruitment criteria in India, fostering a more inclusive and innovative academic environment.
newTitle: UGC Draft Norms Remove NET as Mandatory for Assistant Professor Post
